column4: is it possible to install ubuntu from my hard drive, or do I have to burn a cd and boot from the cd-rom?
yikes!!!... seen someting on TV that really freaked me out!!!
will ubuntu run on a pentium166 ?
I wnt to install it on my celeron700, my p2 450, and my p166
I use the p166 for ham radio stuff
I dont have a cd burner, it it possible to install from a hard drive?
I have 2 hard drives, can it be done from one to the other?
I dont have a raid config
this computer is CHEAP and about 5 yrs old
you can order disks, http://shipit.ubuntu.com/   free, including shipping
I've heard rumors about people using woody boot floppies to get to sarge and from there to ubuntu, but don't quote me on this
yeah, two 1.4 floppies.  That's how I got debian unstable years ago
look for one of those new-fangled ones without a tray, next time :)
cd breaking beats any other new years eve breakage, I think ;)
